comment.author: 76204898@N00
comment._content: Seems to be the same church as the "Russian Orthodox Church of St. Michael the Archangel on 12 Ujazdowskie Ave., Warsaw, Poland" from the LOC's National Photo Company Collection: www.loc.gov/pictures/item/npc2008012514/

comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ujazd%C3%B3w_Avenue Sounds like it might have been destroyed during WWII?

comment.author: 42435981@N00
comment._content: It was demolished in 1923 mainly due to poor condition (not mainteined since 1915), also because it reminded people of Warszawa of the Russian (then soviet) aggressor. pl.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cerkiew_%C5%9Bw._Micha%C5%82a_Archa...

comment.author: 35014516@N03
comment._content: trialsanderrors:  Thanks for noticing that this the same church as the one in our National Photo Company Collection!  We'll include some of that information next time we update the description.
